title: Walgreens Posts Higher Quarterly Profit, Raises Guidance
sub_head: Drugstore chain logged higher sales for its latest quarter, helped by Covid-19 vaccination campaign, strong demand for at-home tests
body:
Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc. said sales and profits rose in its latest quarter, and raised its full-year forecast as demand for Covid-19 vaccines and at-home tests continued to draw customers to its stores.
The Deerfield, Ill., drugstore chain said it administered 15.6 million Covid-19 vaccinations in its first fiscal quarter, which ended Nov. 30. The company also said it has now administered more than 9 million booster shots in total.
